en.start:
18+ 
Note that the creator is not responsible for the content that can be sent by the bot.

Commands are:
- /help to get instructions
- /about to get information about the bot
- /stats to get statistics on the bot
en.help:
The bot is set up to define emoji, that is assigned with the sticker, and to send a sticker with the same emoji assigned from another package. In case there is no other sticker in return, bot sends a message about it and any random sticker from its collection.

The collection of stickers is being updated automatically. Bot checked every sticker it receives and immediately saves new sets, if there are any.

As stickers in the collection are not checked manually, there can be inappropriate content, thus, use the bot carefully and be prepared for bad words. It's the responsibility of sticker's author, not a bot's creator.

Enjoy your use! ü§ñ
en.message is not sticker: As far as I a sticker bot, I am taught to answer commands and stickers, not words. I'm sorry...
en.save sticker: Just a second, I need to save the pack. I will return to you as soon as I am finished
en.no answer: Unfortunatelly, I have no alternatives in my collection... Here is a random sticker, I liked
en.stats:
There are {} sticker sets in my collection
They cover {} emojies

During the hard work, I've sent {} stickers to {} users
en.about:
The bot is set up to define emoji, that is assigned with the sticker, and to send a sticker with the same emoji assigned from another package. The idea was spontaneous.

Data saved from you: I save only your TG ID to remember your activity (number of commands you used, number of stickers I've sent to you, and number of other messages that I've received from you). There is nothing to worry about, this data is used only for analytics by the creator.

Code to the bot is public, you can find it on GitHub and check.
